pages.text: Valkyrien Skies introduced a physics engine to Minecraft, expanding the possibilities of structures from static megabuildings to dynamic machines with realistic physics.$(br2)However, players have long lacked precise control over these structures. Designing turrets, mechanical joints, or other constrained systems often requires bulky transmissions, imprecise angle control, and slow responsiveness.
Meanwhile, propulsion systems impose excessive limitations and suffer from force inaccuracy or transmission dependencies.

This inspired Control Craft, which aims to provide:$(br2)$(li)Constraint devices with built-in controllers (bearings, pistons): Directly set target angles/positions via manual input, redstone interpolation, or scripts.$(br2)$(li)Precision propulsion systems (propellers, vector jets): Adjust thrust magnitude through manual settings, redstone, or scripts.

$(li)Functional blocks (anchors, hinges, cameras): Simplify structural design with versatile utilities.$(br2)$(li)Multi-tool gun: Repair disconnected constraints or bearings instantly, enabling modularity.
